content.question: A cylinder of mass <math alttext="m sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> is attached to the bottom end of a vertical spring, which has its top end fixed in place. The cylinder is held in place with the spring at its unstretched length and then released from rest at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. The cylinder falls downward, reaches a minimum height that is a distance <math alttext="D sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> below its release point, and then reverses direction and moves upward again as it undergoes simple harmonic motion. Which of the following is an expression for the cylinderâ€™s displacement from equilibrium as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction D sub 0 over 2, end fraction, the cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction 2 g over D sub 0, end fraction, end root, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac></msqrt><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction D sub 0 over 2, end fraction, the cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction g over D sub 0, end fraction, end root, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac></msqrt><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="D sub 0, the cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction 2 g over D sub 0, end fraction, end root, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac></msqrt><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="D sub 0, the cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction g over D sub 0, end fraction, end root, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac></msqrt><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction D sub 0 over 2, end fraction, the cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of the fraction 2 g over D sub 0, end fraction, end root, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac></msqrt><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
